title: Ticket #2725: ResidentSetSize appears to get reset when job is put on hold
description:
It appears ResidentSetSize is reset to zero when a job is put on hold.

Locally, we have a SYSTEM_PERIODIC_HOLD expression based on RSS - anything hitting 1.6GB is put on hold. Here's the memory-related classad attributes for a job in the schedd after it has been put on hold: 

ProportionalSetSizeKb = 1750000
ProportionalSetSizeKb_RAW = 1626303
ImageSize = 2000000
ImageSize_RAW = 1838488
ResidentSetSize = 0

Notice the values of PSS and VSIZE from the last run have been preserved, while RSS is reset to 0. I also note that _RAW for ResidentSetSize is missing.

This is from Condor from trunk; I do not know when this behavior started.
remarks:
2011-Dec-22 09:14:00 by bbockelm:
The attached patch causes RSS to work in a manner similar to PSS.

However, it's not obvious why the patch works (the "correct" PSS behavior is likely some unintended side-effect of rounding). Discussing this with danb, there likely should be a MaxResidentSetSize and MaxProportionalSetSizeKb; this would record the largest available value, not the most recent. There are some small race conditions here - what if RSS/PSS is measured as the job is shutting down?

2011-Dec-23 11:02:57 by danb:
In my tests, rounding ResidentSetSize does not reliably prevent this attribute from getting reset to 0. I can't come up with any theory that would explain why it should.

The reason RSS is getting reset to 0 is that in the starter's final update, it computes a total of 0 RSS for the job. The reason PSS is not reset to 0 is an artifact of the way PSS is handled. Instead of getting 0 for the total PSS, the starter gets the result "no PSS available", so it doesn't send an update to PSS in the final update.

I discussed with Todd and he agrees that we should change the definition of ResidentSetSize and ProportionalSetSizeKb to be maximums, like ImageSize. This seems more useful for batch jobs. If instantaneous values are ever desired, new attributes could be added to provide those.
attachments:
• rss_fix.patch 397 bytes added by bbockelm on 2011-Dec-21 22:36:41 UTC.
    Quick fix - anything that's rounded appears to be preserved after being put on hold. No idea why.
